results.title: New Guinea: highland regions
results.brief_description: Shows one of the extensive fertile valleys to be found amoung the mountains in New Guinea and discusses its development under Australian administration. Illustrates activities and conditions in the district, stressing the difficulty and importance of communication.

results.title: New Guinea highway
results.brief_description: Shows the highway which pushes its way for 350 miles from the coast into the highlands, bringing communication to dozens of tribes for the first time. With Bird of Paradise feathers streaming behind him, the ochre-painted “warrior” from the highlands careers down to Goroka on a bicycle for the Highland Agricultural Show.

results.title: New Guinea election story
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Twenty-one years before achieving their independence, New Guineans were able to vote for a transitional form of representative democracy in 1964. Singular logistical problems - of language, and geography - had to be summited, and this film chronicles that process

results.title: New generations
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
The mechanism of human reproduction are explained and illustrated. A sequence showing the birth of a baby is included. The film is intended for children 12-14 years.

results.title: New games
results.brief_description: Television footage showing organised games devised by members of a community on the outskirts of San Francisco in the 1970s. Games stress participation and are non-competitive - such as fencing with styrofoam foils and interchangeable teams in an extended rope tug of war.

results.title: New games
results.brief_description: New games is a series of non-competitive games designed for the whole family, which have recently been introduced into Australia from America through the activities of Victoria’s Department of Youth, Sport and Recreation. New games includes a wide range of activities - from kite flying and human pyramid building to games with a giant earth ball.
